item.title: Temple of Doom
item.author: wouter.brunenberg@outlook.com (Wouter Brunenberg)
item.description: Overview üó∫Ô∏è ‘Temple of Doom’ is a console application developed using the .NET MVC framework. The goal of this assignment was to practice a lot of different design patterns. The front consisted of a console with different characters and colours, depending on the type of object and if it had a colour property assigned to it (in the case of a key or coloured door for example). Technologies Used üõ†Ô∏è C# .

item.title: Reversi
item.author: wouter.brunenberg@outlook.com (Wouter Brunenberg)
item.description: Overview üó∫Ô∏è ‘Temple of Doom’ is a console application developed for a school assignment. The goal of making this application was to achieve a good understanding of OOP (Object Oriented Programming). I had to recreate the board game ‘Reversi’. The player(s) have to answer a few questions about the game configuration before starting. After that, it’s just a normal game of Reversi. Technologies Used üõ†Ô∏è Java Eclipse OOP (Object Oriented Programming) Challenges and Solutions üßóüèª Initially it was a little difficult to get a grasp on the concept of OOP (Object Oriented Programming).
